706121f-a.title: Brooklyn: Ocean Parkway - Sea Breeze Avenue
706121f-a.text:
Ocean Parkway, west side, north of Sea Breene Ave, showing the Church
of the Guardian Angel (P.E).
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706121f-a.folder: Ocean Parkway & Sea Breeze Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706122f-a.title: Brooklyn: Ocean Parkway - Sea Breeze Avenue
706122f-a.text:
Ocean Parkway, west side, between Sea Breeze Ave., and the right of way of the B..T. Brighton Beach Line. To the left, partially seen, is te Hotel
Shelburne.
DDecember 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706122f-a.folder: Ocean Parkway & Sea Breeze Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706123f-a.title: Brooklyn: Ocean Parkway - Sea Breeze Avenue
706123f-a.text:
Ocean Parkway, west side, north of Sea Breeze Ave., sho ing at the N.W. corner the Hotel Shelburne. At the right is seen the Brighton Beach Subs ay
viaduct over Ocean Parkway.
About 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706123f-a.folder: Ocean Parkway & Sea Breeze Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706694f-a.title: Brooklyn: Sea Breeze Avenue - Ocean Parkway
706694f-a.text:
Sea Breeze Ave., north side, between Ocean Pkway., and Reigelmann Board Walk. In the foreground, is Sea Side Park. At left, the Peoples Bathing
Pavilion.
August 6, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
706694f-a.folder: Sea Breeze Avenue & Ocean Parkway, Brooklyn, NY

706124f-a.title: Brooklyn: Ocean Parkway - Sea Breeze Avenue
706124f-a.text:
Ocean Parkway, west side, south from Sea Breeze Ave., showing the shelter house at the N.W. corner of Ocean Parkway and Concourse Drive.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706124f-a.folder: Ocean Parkway & Sea Breeze Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706693f-a.title: Brooklyn: Sea Breeze Avenue - Ocean Parkway
706693f-a.text:
(1)
Sea Breeze Ave., at the N.W. corner of Ocean Parkway and Sea Breeze Ave., showing the Hotel Shelburne, built by Edward Somerville. It was opened on June 15, 1904, and was known as the "Concourse Hotel", later it became the "Riccadonna" and after that The Jefferson. Louis Fisher bought it in 1913, and gave it the above name which remained until the
building was dismantled and demolished in May 1928.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the north side of the Hetel, viewed from the
Brighton Beach subway station.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing a view east to West 1st Street.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706693f-a.folder: Sea Breeze Avenue & Ocean Parkway, Brooklyn, NY
